document.heading: Uniform Family Support Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-137, the “Uniform Family Support Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-151 which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 7, 2006, and April 4, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 26, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-366 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-137 became effective on June 22, 2006.
